benchmark_details.name: EvidenceBench
benchmark_details.overview: EvidenceBench is introduced as a benchmark for extracting relevant evidence from biomedical papers, based on a novel pipeline involving hypothesis generation and sentence-level annotation guided by human expert judgments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure model performance on the task of evidence retrieval in biomedical literature.

data.source: A collection of 107,887 CC-BY open-sourced biomedical research papers and 44,772 review papers from PubMed Central.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by experts and automated using Large Language Models (LLMs).

methodology.calculation: Aspect Recall measures the fraction of study aspects covered by a retrieved set of sentences.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Aspect Recall indicates better model performance in retrieving relevant sentences.
methodology.validation: Performance was validated through a test set of annotated research papers.
